case_vignette: A 17-year-old girl comes to the physician because of a 2-day history of pain in her right knee. Last week she had right wrist pain. She has no history of recent trauma. She returned from summer camp in Connecticut 2 weeks ago. She is sexually active with one male partner and uses an oral contraceptive. Her temperature is 38°C (100.4°F). Examination shows several painless vesiculopustular lesions on the back and one lesion on the right sole of the foot. There is swelling of the right knee with tenderness to palpation. Passive extension of the right wrist and fingers elicits pain.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having pain in my right knee for two days, and last week my right wrist was hurting as well.
What is your age and sex?
I'm a 17-year-old girl.
Have you had any recent injuries or trauma to your knee or wrist?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries or trauma.
Do you have a history of any autoimmune diseases or arthritis in your family?
I don't know about any autoimmune diseases or arthritis in my family.
Have you had any recent illness or infection? Any fever, rash, or other symptoms?
I returned from summer camp two weeks ago and I've got a fever of 38°C (100.4°F); there are also some painless spots on my back and a spot on the bottom of my right foot.
Are you taking any medications or have any known allergies?
I use an oral contraceptive, but I don't know of any allergies I might have.
**Final Diagnosis:** Lyme Disease
